title: Nidalee, Trundle or Rengar jungle?
body:
Hi guys, I'm a pretty experienced jungler, but I've been wondering who to buy for jungling. I like asassins/fighters but have been picking up tanks and liking them. I want someone who can carry Bronze 3, however that doesnt mean I want someone easy to play. The ones I've been thinking about are Trundle, Nidalee and Rengar. 

Please reply with your thoughts and if you have any other suggestions please feel free to share them with me. 

If you could answer the following in your post about either your suggestion or why I should/shouldn't  buy one of the ones I'm thinking about that would be great:
1. **damage**
2. **versatility**
3. **carry potential**
4. **teamfighting power**

Edit: I'm not sure if this is the right place to post this because it is my first time posting on a forum/discussion :/

replies.body: I personally believe all round that trundle is the best pick, he's a very diverse champion and super strong all throughout the game, the problem i have with Nidalee and Rengar is they're weak early on and if you don't get snowballing it's almost impossible to carry, not to mention the fact that if you get invaded & die at LVL1-4 it will set you back so much and make it super hard for you to safely gank/ catch up.

1. **Damage**

 {{champion:76}} - 8
{{champion:107}} - 10
 {{champion:48}} - 6

2. **Versatility**

 {{champion:76}} - 5
{{champion:107}} - 4
 {{champion:48}} - 9
 
3. **Carry potential**

 {{champion:76}} - 10
{{champion:107}} - 9
 {{champion:48}} - 7
4. **Teamfighting power**

 {{champion:76}} - 4
{{champion:107}} - 7
 {{champion:48}} - 9

I wouldn't recommend **Nidalee** TBH, she's really hard to play. I'd go **Rengar** or **Trundle** depending on your playstyle.

> I wouldn't recommend **Nidalee** TBH, she's really hard to play. I'd go **Rengar** or **Trundle** depending on your playstyle.

I tried nid the other day as she is free this week. It was a bot game, yes, but I had to go leashless and got through it by going q then e and healing whenever it was up and i was below 70% health.

{{champion:76}} 
1) Damage - Very weak if not marked with passive.
2) Pretty versatile at many situations and can build depending on game.
3) Carry potential - **8/10(2/10)**: extremely bad if you can't hit the long Qs.
4) Teamfighting power - **4/10**: No skills to really help in teamfights, Nidalee picks people out instead of teamfights.

Overall: **7/10.**

{{champion:48}} 
1) Damage - Very strong early and amazing when fed.
2) Trundle can also build accordingly, although he has no "real" escape.
3)Carry potential -** 7/10**: W is a huge boost for Trundle making ganking easy especially with his E.
4) Teamfighting power - **8/10**: E is very useful for picking out the backline carries as well as destroying tanks with his Ultimate.

Overall: **7/10**
{{champion:107}} 
1) Damage - Amazingly strong, especially with his passive making them unmatchable early game.
2) Not too versatile, he can get caught very easily and his build path is fixed.
3) Carry potential - **10/10**: Deadly if the Rengar player is experienced.
4) Teamfighting power **7/10**: Empowered E gives that time for you(or your team) to burst down the enemy carry.

Overall: **9/10**

In terms of mechanics, {{champion:48}} would be the easiest to learn.

Personally, i'd pick {{champion:107}} because of his high damage output.

(This is all from my experience)

I didnt really get anyone because i had no time to farm up any IP. (No time to play.) I'm thinking maybe j4 cause he got a buff this patch, and a great one at that. Is his clearing easier than before (i heard it was hard before the buff) after his w buff? So I'm thinking I may get jarvan, so thwt i can abuse his ult and w buffs before he gets nerfed in some other way, use Vi as well, and then maybe get trundle or some other good jungler that can also top.

Tell me your thoughts :)

Nidalee is really rewarding, particularly with the new Runic Echoes enchantment. A charged Nidalee spear with Rylais is enough to slow down an entire enemy team lategame, and if you take the time to learn her she can carry harder than the other two.

Rengar is a good short term investment. The shock factor is what makes Rengar so strong at the moment, but skilled players can shut him down easily. That being said, he's practically freelo in Bronze so go for your life!

Trundle is really versatile, but since the nerf to his bite (and thus his splitpush) he's a little less versatile than he used to be. You're probably better off playing Udyr because of his synergy with Devourer and Guinsoos.

Thank you guys. I will get Rengar first as i didnt really do so well as nidalee in a game today. I didnt really understand what i was doing as rengar the first and only time i played him. But i have read some guides and might be able to get used to him.

I never thought i would get so many views and comments. Especially as this is my first discussion/forum. So I just want to say thank you, again. I am still open to suggestions and will try to check this forum daily, so please post a comment on this.

But for the summoners JustTrash and  Telecasterdude, you guys were really informative and would like to reward you with a cookie! 

{{item:2054}} {{item:2010}}

Take your pick!
I like all of them but realised that I suck hard at rango and slighly less so at nid. Trundle's kit best matches my playstyle so he is my fav pick of those three.
{{champion:121}} can be pretty good

> [{quoted}](name=tURtL3s,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=8l0b4y7i,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2016-03-06T01:00:42.524+0000)
>
> {{champion:121}} can be pretty good

Yeah I've thought about him too. Definately gonna get him within the next 5-6 champions I will buy not including nidalee who I haven't had the chance to log in and buy yet.
My pick is Volibear or Yi, both can carry hard

> [{quoted}](name=RomeoPM,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=8l0b4y7i,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2016-03-05T13:25:46.573+0000)
>
> My pick is Volibear or Yi, both can carry hard

I already said that i have yi and "main" him as he has my highest mastery score.
Yeah I know, those are just my picks

> [{quoted}](name=RomeoPM,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=8l0b4y7i,comment-id=000a00000000,timestamp=2016-03-05T15:23:01.632+0000)
>
> Yeah I know, those are just my picks

OH! I completely misunderstood your post. I thought you meant to get voli and yi. Not that those were your go to ones. Or do you mean something else? I'm confused.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} 

 But I think you meant that those were either your go to champs for jungling or the ones you reccommend regardless of whether or not i have played them.

For me, Voli is on my list of "gets" but not as high up ther as others like the three i first mentioned and **maybe** nocturne. However, I the only reason that i can think of that I haven't bought him is because I don't want to spend (and possibly waste) 4800 IP someone that I have no idea if I will find fun. I totally want to get voli, but until he goes on free week or I get other champions with a higher priority, I'm just worried to get him.

Thanks for reminding me about him. I've been interested in him since before I even installed the game. I was just perusing through the champion list under game info and he was one of the several that caught my eye and got me to click on them for more info.

but trundle is easy to play... I recommend nocturne!!!! Sounds like he would fit your play style, and he is good to carry games, very strong early and late, high carry potential, amazing ganks with r and still really good even without it. Can build flexible, onhit, tank, assassin, offtank whatever you want. Decent cc, lots of mobility and high output. Attackspeed bonus + a steroid and spellshield, his fear lets him win nearly 99% if they are of equal or lower level) of all 1v1 fights, doesn't really have many super hard counters either. Otherwords, an elo boosting machine.

MARRMESS - {{champion:150}}

> MARRMESS - {{champion:150}}

Please explain. Apparently Marrmess is summoner in europe nordic and east but give me some {{summoner:13}} please. Is that your main account?

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=8l0b4y7i,comment-id=000700000000,timestamp=2016-03-05T13:14:14.074+0000)
>
> seems it needs some {{summoner:13}}  then;
> 
> Taunting an enemy {{champion:56}}  Nocturne as {{champion:150}}  Gnar
> [- "Marrmess"](http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/2/2e/Gnar.tauntNocturne.ogg/revision/latest?cb=20140805221638)

Ok it all makes sense now i found this. Good point i might get noc after trundle and rengar (still cant decide who to get first).

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2c4j4q/gnars_special_interactions_with_champions/
rengo

I don't know why, but I don't  really like nocturne for some reason, I dont know why though. I meN, its not that I dont like him but I'm not as drawn to him as I am to others

I think I've decided by doing a bit if other research and looking on other forums. I will get nidalee now, because I like her kit and I love the idea of changing forms and I did really well with her early clears when I see other people having a hard time with it.
So that's settled. Again, thank you so much for the people that gave me suggestions and responses. 

Now the question is who to get next. Trundle, Rengar or someone else. Trundle seems like a good choice for the tankiness and versatility. Rengar however, dispite his "nerfs" that didn't seem like nerfs to me, but I probably misread the patch notes, seems good to carry and assassinate carries. At least, thats how they appear to me. I've only played Rengar once and that game i did alright on him but didn't know how to manage his ferocity or anything. I have no experience with Trundle so out of those two (or another) I could try. I'm hoping they're in next week's free week for me to try out. 
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

 I need advice wise summoners!
If you wanna get out of Bronze then of course the obvious pick is {{champion:11}} .

> [{quoted}](name=JustTrash,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=8l0b4y7i,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-03-05T08:57:13.898+0000)
>
> If you wanna get out of Bronze then of course the obvious pick is {{champion:11}} .

I have Yi and he is my highest mastery champion. I have his Project skin with the special loading card soooo.... 

I probably should've mentioned that in my OP. I like his playstyle.

I'm thinking nidalee based on your guys' comments. I like that she's got a change form ulti as those are really rare (there are like 4 or 5 of those in the game, right?) and I have elise. I like nid's mark/hunt mechanic (the passive). I might go nidalee then rengar or trundle, before getting the one i didn't get second (am I making sense?).

But thanks guys and keep the great replies coming!

I probably should've mentioned in the OP that I don't mind if the champion is hard to learn/master. I prefer mid/late game champs and like Master Yi{{champion:11}} . In fact I would actually prefer a champion that is hard to master. Like I said I like assassin/fighters. I enjoy skirmish champs and ones that have huge carry potential, while having the ability to fall back on a tanky path for when I am behind. I like Yi's build path where he gets one or maybe two defensive items while focusing on damage.

Thanks for the replies guys. I'm still drifting between the three.
When I played Rek'Sai I didn't really like her :( but thank you for the suggestion!

I recommend the following 3 champions:

The Strong AD/Tank champion Rek'Sai{{champion:421}}:

- High damage potential.
- High mobility.
- Large health.
- Excellent in team fights.
- A knock up that effects a small area.
- Single medium/long range snipe shot.
- Melee attack.
---
The extreme AoE tank Amumu{{champion:32}}:

- Medium Mobility
- High Magic damage.
- Gigantic Health.
- Huge armour.
- AoE spells. (makes Amumu great in team fights)
- A passive that lowers MR (Magic resistance) on enemies.
- Lots of CC.
- Melee attack.

---
The long ranged burst assassin/fighter Nidalee{{champion:76}}:

- Extreme high burst damage.
- High mobility.
- Use of Team effective spells.
- Medium Health.
- Low Armour.
- Minimum CC.
- Ranged attack.
(I would have picked Nidalee in the survey answer but she is extremely difficult to jungle with).

Good Luck with these champions hopefully I've helped and Best of Luck on the Rift!{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
